page.title: 03JEDFOREST RUGBY CLUB
page.content: In 1985,the Jedforest R.F.C.was{one hundred years old,and the occasion has been marked in a variety of ways__a Centenary booklet,a special match against the Co-optomists,a special dinner in the Town Hall,and an end of season tour to Holland and Germany. The Centenary booklet tells the story in words and pictures of the last hundred years,while Jedforest lost narrowly to the Co-ops.which was nearly the full Scotland side. The dinner in the Town Hall had many distinguished guests.The main speaker was Hamish Kemp,S.R.U.President,and Dod Burrell of the 1977 Lions also took part.Jed's caps_Bill Purdie 1939,Charlie McDONALD 1947,Davie Rose 1953-55,Hugh Duffy 1955,and Roy Laidlaw with over 30 caps since 1980,were all present.The club survived another season in Division 1.
